ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 196
ygData.msgSnippet: I used the EQ emulator to check this mystery out.  When you use the emulator, all doors and many other objects are not drawn; thus a wall with a door in the
ygData.messageBody:
I used the EQ emulator to check this mystery out. When you use the
emulator, all doors and many other objects are not drawn; thus a wall with a
door in the game is just an entry without a door in the emulator. So, I
thought if rotating the star lamp does open a door close by, I would see
this hidden passageway in the emulator. Well, I searched all over that part
of akanon; under water too, and I saw no new passages. I think it's a red
herring.

Kilkin

-----Original Message-----
From: Conrad Lesnewski [mailto:clesnew@...]
Sent: Sunday, January 09, 2000 5:36 PM
To: EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Digest Number 196

From: Conrad Lesnewski <clesnew@...>

At 10:18 AM 1/10/00 +1300, you wrote:
>From: jbuckingham@...
>
>
>> I have seen the lamp you are talking about. Never found
out what it was
>triggering. It was
>> mentioned a few months ago on this list when we were
still looking
>desperately for the 3rd
>>book/fishing pole recipe. I don't remember anyone coming
up with an answer
>about it.
>
>It's not triggering anything, the creaking sound is merely
the lantern
>itself revolving, not some hidden door.
>
I don;t know about that. With a 3D sound card, that
creaking sound comes
from behind me and down the corridor, not from the lantern
in front of me.

Calbasil Psyrex of Ak'anon (Bertoxx)
Archmage of The House of Silmindo
